        Best Paper
        
         
        
      
        
      
        
         
        
            
        Determining Application-specific Peak Power and Energy Requirements for Ultra-low
                     Power Processors
        
            
          
               
        • Hari Cherupalli, 
          • 
               
        • Henry Duwe, 
          • 
               
        • Weidong Ye, 
          • 
               
        • Rakesh Kumar, 
          • 
               
        • John Sartori
          • 
            
        
            
        ASPLOS '17: Proceedings of the Twenty-Second International Conference on Architectural Support
                     for Programming Languages and Operating SystemsApril 2017, pp 3–16https://doi.org/10.1145/3037697.3037711
        
            
        
               		
               
        Many emerging applications such as IoT, wearables, implantables, and sensor networks
                  are power- and energy-constrained. These applications rely on ultra-low-power processors
                  that have rapidly become the most abundant type of processor manufactured ...
        
            
        
            
        
               
        Also Published in:
        ACM SIGPLAN Notices: Volume 52 Issue 4, April 2017 ACM SIGARCH Computer Architecture News: Volume 45 Issue 1, March 2017

          Estimating mobile application energy consumption using program analysis
          
            
            
               
          • Shuai Hao, 
            • 
               
          • Ding Li, 
            • 
               
          • William G. J. Halfond, 
            • 
               
          • Ramesh Govindan
            • 
            
          
            
          ICSE '13: Proceedings of the 2013 International Conference on Software EngineeringMay 2013, pp 92–101
          
            
          
               		
               
           Optimizing the energy efficiency of mobile applications can greatly increase user
                  satisfaction. However, developers lack viable techniques for estimating the energy
                  consumption of their applications. This paper proposes a new approach that is both
                  ...

            research-article
            
         
            November 2017
            
         
         
            Public Access
            
         
         
            Published By ACM
            
         
            
      
            
      
            
         
            
            
            Improving Energy Efficiency in Memory-constrained Applications Using Core-specific
                     Power Control
            
            
              
               
            • Sridutt Bhalachandra, 
              • 
               
            • Allan Porterfield, 
              • 
               
            • Stephen L. Olivier, 
              • 
               
            • Jan F. Prins, 
              • 
               
            • Robert J. Fowler
              • 
            
            
            
            E2SC'17: Proceedings of the 5th International Workshop on Energy Efficient SupercomputingNovember 2017, Article No.: 6, pp 1–8https://doi.org/10.1145/3149412.3149418
            
            
            
               		
               
            Power is increasingly the limiting factor in High Performance Computing (HPC) at Exascale
                  and will continue to influence future advancements in supercomputing. Recent processors
                  equipped with on-board hardware counters allow real time monitoring of ...

              research-article
              
         
              October 2008
              
         
         
              Published By ACM
              
         
              
      
              
      
              
         
              
            
              Efficient code caching to improve performance and energy consumption for java applications
              
            
                
               
              • Yu Sun, 
                • 
               
              • Wei Zhang
                • 
            
              
            
              CASES '08: Proceedings of the 2008 international conference on Compilers, architectures and synthesis
                     for embedded systemsOctober 2008, pp 119–126https://doi.org/10.1145/1450095.1450115
              
            
              
               		
               
              Java applications rely on Just-In-Time (JIT) compilers or adaptive compilers to generate
                  and optimize binary code at runtime to boost performance. In conventional Java Virtual
                  Machines (JVM), however, the binary code is typically written into the data ...

                May 2017
                
         
         
                
      
                
      
                
         
                
            
                Reducing energy consumption of resource-intensive scientific mobile applications via
                     code refactoring
                
            
                  
               
                • Ana Rodriguez
                  • 
            
                
            
                ICSE-C '17: Proceedings of the 39th International Conference on Software Engineering CompanionMay 2017, pp 475–476https://doi.org/10.1109/ICSE-C.2017.33
                
            
                
               		
               
                The advent of new computing paradigms such as Mobile Grids and Mobile-edge Clouds,
                  and the increasing number of mobile devices with ever-growing capabilities makes them
                  attractive to users running scientific and HPC applications. However, mobile devices
                  ...

                  research-article
                  
         
                  March 2010
                  
         
         
                  
      
                  
      
                  
         
                  
            
                  Including real-life application code into power aware network simulation
                  
            
                    
               
                  • Georg Möstl, 
                    • 
               
                  • Richard Hagelauer, 
                    • 
               
                  • Andreas Springer, 
                    • 
               
                  • Gerhard Müller
                    • 
            
                  
            
                  SIMUTools '10: Proceedings of the 3rd International ICST Conference on Simulation Tools and TechniquesMarch 2010, Article No.: 58, pp 1–6https://doi.org/10.4108/ICST.SIMUTOOLS2010.8643
                  
            
                  
               		
               
                  We present a methodology and a toolset for power aware HW/SW co-simulation including
                  real-life application code at network level.
                   
               
                  The toolset consists of the known OMNeT++ network simulation environment and the PAWiS
                  framework, which was extended to ...
                  
               
                  
            
                  
            
                  
               
                  
                  
                  
                     
                    
                        
                  • 
                           
                    
                              
                      
                                 
                    • 0
                      • 
                                 
                                 
                    • 53

                    Fine-Grained Energy Modeling for the Source Code of a Mobile Application
                    
            
                      
               
                    • Xueliang Li, 
                      • 
               
                    • John P. Gallagher
                      • 
            
                    
            
                    MOBIQUITOUS 2016: Proceedings of the 13th International Conference on Mobile and Ubiquitous Systems:
                     Computing, Networking and ServicesNovember 2016, pp 180–189https://doi.org/10.1145/2994374.2994394
                    
            
                    
               		
               
                    The goal of an energy model for source code is to lay a foundation for the application
                  of energy-aware programming techniques. State of the art solutions are based on source-line
                  energy information. In this paper, we present an approach to constructing ...

                      Post-compiler software optimization for reducing energy
                      
            
                        
               
                      • Eric Schulte, 
                        • 
               
                      • Jonathan Dorn, 
                        • 
               
                      • Stephen Harding, 
                        • 
               
                      • Stephanie Forrest, 
                        • 
               
                      • Westley Weimer
                        • 
            
                      
            
                      ASPLOS '14: Proceedings of the 19th international conference on Architectural support for programming
                     languages and operating systemsFebruary 2014, pp 639–652https://doi.org/10.1145/2541940.2541980
                      
            
                      
               		
               
                      Modern compilers typically optimize for executable size and speed, rarely exploring
                  non-functional properties such as power efficiency. These properties are often hardware-specific,
                  time-intensive to optimize, and may not be amenable to standard ...

                  systems with solar energy harvesting.                      and MeasurementSeptember 2016, Article No.: 37, pp 1–10https://doi.org/10.1145/2961111.2962593

                  the energy consumed by a software is, however, a difficult challenge due to the large
                  number of factors affecting it -- namely, features of the processor, memory, ...

                  the source code of a software system. Test cases are executed to obtain energy consumption
                  measurements, and a statistical method, based on spectrum-based fault ...

                     task graphs with dynamic elements

                     for Multicores and ManycoresFebruary 2020, Article No.: 8, pp 1–10https://doi.org/10.1145/3380536.3380544
                                
            
                                
               		
               
                                Streaming task graphs are a high-level construct used to specify parallel applications
                  operating on streams of data, and energy-efficient code meeting data throughput requirements
                  can be generated automatically.                   of programs through use of techniques, implemented in the compiler. This problem is

                     & disparity estimation in multiview video coding

                  sectors, etc.) is driven by an extensive analysis of memory-usage behavior ...

                                              Application Runtime Variability and Power Optimization for Exascale Computers
                                              
            
                                                
               
                                              • Allan Porterfield, 
                                                • 
               
                                              • Rob Fowler, 
                                                • 
               
                                              • Sridutt Bhalachandra, 
                                                • 
               
                                              • Barry Rountree, 
                                                • 
               
                                              • Diptorup Deb, 
                                                • 
               
                                              • Rob Lewis
                                                • 
            
                                              
            
                                              ROSS '15: Proceedings of the 5th International Workshop on Runtime and Operating Systems for
                     SupercomputersJune 2015, Article No.: 3, pp 1–8https://doi.org/10.1145/2768405.2768408
                                              
            
                                              
               		
               
                                              Exascale computing will be as much about solving problems with the least power/energy
                  as about solving them quickly. In the future, systems are likely to be over-provisioned
                  with processors and will rely on hardware-enforced power bounds to allow ...

                                                Performance & Energy Tradeoffs for Dependent Distributed Applications Under System-wide
                     Power Caps
                                                
            
                                                  
               
                                                • Huazhe Zhang, 
                                                  • 
               
                                                • Henry Hoffmann
                                                  • 
            
                                                
            
                                                ICPP 2018: Proceedings of the 47th International Conference on Parallel ProcessingAugust 2018, Article No.: 67, pp 1–11https://doi.org/10.1145/3225058.3225098
                                                
            
                                                
               		
               
                                                Large scale parallel machines are subject to system-wide power budgets (or caps).
                  As these machines grow in capacity, they can concurrently execute dependent applications
                  that were previously processed serially. Such application coupling saves IO and ...

                                                  Automated energy optimization of HTTP requests for mobile applications
                                                  
            
                                                    
               
                                                  • Ding Li, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Yingjun Lyu, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • Jiaping Gui, 
                                                    • 
               
                                                  • William G. J. Halfond
                                                    • 
            
                                                  
            
                                                  ICSE '16: Proceedings of the 38th International Conference on Software EngineeringMay 2016, pp 249–260https://doi.org/10.1145/2884781.2884867
                                                  
            
                                                  
               		
               
                                                  Energy is a critical resource for apps that run on mobile devices. Among all operations,
                  making HTTP requests is one of the most energy consuming. Previous studies have shown
                  that bundling smaller HTTP requests into a single larger HTTP request can be ...

                                                    OpenMP and MPI application energy measurement variation
                                                    
            
                                                      
               
                                                    • Allan Porterfield, 
                                                      • 
               
                                                    • Rob Fowler, 
                                                      • 
               
                                                    • Sridutt Bhalachandra, 
                                                      • 
               
                                                    • Wei Wang
                                                      • 
            
                                                    
            
                                                    E2SC '13: Proceedings of the 1st International Workshop on Energy Efficient SupercomputingNovember 2013, Article No.: 7, pp 1–8https://doi.org/10.1145/2536430.2536437
                                                    
            
                                                    
               		
               
                                                    Power, energy, and compute time are all important metrics that can act as either objectives
                  or constraints in program or system optimization. Recent microprocessors include sensors
                  (counters) for monitoring these metrics as well as on-chip system ...

                                                      An energy aware application controller for optimizing renewable energy consumption
                     in data centres

                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Mehdi Sheikhalishahi, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Federico M. Facca, 
                                                        • 
               
                                                      • Fabien Hermenier
                                                        • 
            
                                                      
            
                                                      UCC '15: Proceedings of the 8th International Conference on Utility and Cloud ComputingDecember 2015, pp 195–204

                  of energy in order to address the environmental challenges of the century. In order
                  to operate data centres with renewable energies we have to mitigate their volatile
                  and ...

                                                          Remove RATs from your code: automated optimization of resource inefficient database
                     writes for mobile applications

                                                            • 
               
                                                          • Ding Li, 
                                                            •

                     AnalysisJuly 2018, pp 310–321https://doi.org/10.1145/3213846.3213865

                  few resources as possible. Most of these apps make use of local databases to store
                  and access data locally. Prior work has found that local database services have become
                  ...

                                                            Effects of source-code optimizations on GPU performance and energy consumption
                                                            
            
                                                              
               
                                                            • Jared Coplin, 
                                                              • 
               
                                                            • Martin Burtscher
                                                              • 
            
                                                            
            
                                                            GPGPU-8: Proceedings of the 8th Workshop on General Purpose Processing using GPUsFebruary 2015, pp 48–58https://doi.org/10.1145/2716282.2716292
                                                            
            
                                                            
               		
               
                                                             This paper studies the effects of source-code optimizations on the performance, power
                  draw, and energy consumption of a modern compute GPU. We evaluate 128 versions of
                  two n-body codes: a compute-bound regular implementation and a memory-bound ...

                                                              Reducing L1 caches power by exploiting software semantics
                                                              
            
                                                                
               
                                                              • Zhen Fang, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Li Zhao, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Xiaowei Jiang, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Shih-lien Lu, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Ravi Iyer, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Tong Li, 
                                                                • 
               
                                                              • Seung Eun Lee
                                                                • 
            
                                                              
            
                                                              ISLPED '12: Proceedings of the 2012 ACM/IEEE international symposium on Low power electronics
                     and designJuly 2012, pp 391–396https://doi.org/10.1145/2333660.2333750
                                                              
            
                                                              
               		
               
                                                              To access a set-associative L1 cache in a high-performance processor, all ways of
                  the selected set are searched and fetched in parallel using physical address bits.
                  Such a cache is oblivious of memory references' software semantics such as stack-heap
                  ...
                                                              
               
                                                              
            
                                                              
            
                                                              
               
                                                              
                  
                                                              
                     
                                                                
                        
                                                              •

                                                                  •

                                                                Power reduction via macroblock prioritization for power aware H.264 video applications

                                                                  •

                     codesign and system synthesisOctober 2008, pp 261–266https://doi.org/10.1145/1450135.1450195
                                                                
            
                                                                
               		
               
                                                                As the importance of multimedia applications in hand-held devices increases, the computational
                  strain and corresponding demand for energy in such devices continues to grow. Portable
                  multimedia devices with inherently limited energy supplies face tight ...

                                                                  January 2010
                                                                  
         
         
                                                                  
      
                                                                  
      
                                                                  
         
                                                                  
            
                                                                  Maximizing the harvested energy for micro-power applications through efficient MPPT
                     and PMU design
                                                                  
            
                                                                    
               
                                                                  • Hui Shao, 
                                                                    • 
               
                                                                  • Chi-Ying Tsui, 
                                                                    • 
               
                                                                  • Wing-Hung Ki
                                                                    • 
            
                                                                  
            
                                                                  ASPDAC '10: Proceedings of the 2010 Asia and South Pacific Design Automation ConferenceJanuary 2010, pp 75–80
                                                                  
            
                                                                  
               		
               
                                                                  Energy harvesting is becoming more and more popular for micro-power applications where
                  the environmental energy is used to power up the systems. In order to prolong the
                  device lifetime and guarantee the system operation, the harvested power from the ...

                                                                    Improving the energy efficiency of software systems for multi-core architectures
                                                                    
            
                                                                      
               
                                                                    • Maxime Colmant, 
                                                                      • 
               
                                                                    • Romain Rouvoy, 
                                                                      • 
               
                                                                    • Lionel Seinturier
                                                                      • 
            
                                                                    
            
                                                                    MDS '14: Proceedings of the 11th Middleware Doctoral SymposiumDecember 2014, Article No.: 1, pp 1–4https://doi.org/10.1145/2684080.2684081
                                                                    
            
                                                                    
               		
               
                                                                    The ICT has an huge impact on the world CO2 emissions and recent study estimates its account to 2% of these emissions. This growing
                  account emissions makes IT energy efficiency an important challenge. State-of-the-art
                  has proven that the processor is ...

                                                                      Software energy optimization in the cloud
                                                                      
            
                                                                        
               
                                                                      • Andreas Bergen, 
                                                                        • 
               
                                                                      • Nina Taherimakhsousi
                                                                        • 
            
                                                                      
            
                                                                      CASCON '16: Proceedings of the 26th Annual International Conference on Computer Science and Software
                     EngineeringOctober 2016, pp 243–249
                                                                      
            
                                                                      
               		
               
                                                                      A promising avenue to control energy-related costs in enterprise data centers is to
                  investigate power-aware resource management strategies. Mechanisms to accurately capture
                  energy consumption in data centers include source and machine code instruction ...

                                                                        Leveraging energy storage to optimize data center electricity cost in emerging power
                     markets
                                                                        
            
                                                                          
               
                                                                        • Yuanyuan Shi, 
                                                                          • 
               
                                                                        • Bolun Xu, 
                                                                          • 
               
                                                                        • Baosen Zhang, 
                                                                          • 
               
                                                                        • Di Wang
                                                                          • 
            
                                                                        
            
                                                                        e-Energy '16: Proceedings of the Seventh International Conference on Future Energy SystemsJune 2016, Article No.: 18, pp 1–13https://doi.org/10.1145/2934328.2934346
                                                                        
            
                                                                        
               		
               
                                                                        Energy storage in data centers has mainly been used as devices to backup generators
                  during power outages. Recently there has been a growing interest in using energy storage
                  devices to actively shape power consumption in data centers to reduce their ...

                                                                          A dynamic-programming algorithm for reducing the energy consumption of pipelined system-level
                     streaming applications
                                                                          
            
                                                                            
               
                                                                          • N. Liveris, 
                                                                            • 
               
                                                                          • H. Zhou, 
                                                                            • 
               
                                                                          • P. Banerjee
                                                                            • 
            
                                                                          
            
                                                                          ASP-DAC '08: Proceedings of the 2008 Asia and South Pacific Design Automation ConferenceJanuary 2008, pp 42–48
                                                                          
            
                                                                          
               		
               
                                                                          In this paper we present a System-Level technique for reducing energy consumption.
                  The technique is applicable to pipelined applications represented as chain-structured
                  graphs and targets the energy overhead of switching between active and sleep mode.
                  ...

                                                                            Toward application-specific memory reconfiguration for energy efficiency

                                                                              •

                                                                              •

                  continued increase of computing performance. An important approach to increasing energy-efficiency
                  is hardware customization. In this study we explore the opportunity for ...

                                                                              A code morphing methodology to automate power analysis countermeasures
                                                                              
            
                                                                                
               
                                                                              • Giovanni Agosta, 
                                                                                •

                                                                                • 
               
                                                                              • Gerardo Pelosi
                                                                                •

                                                                              We introduce a general framework to automate the application of countermeasures against
                  Differential Power Attacks aimed at software implementations of cryptographic primitives.
                  The approach enables the generation of multiple versions of the code, to ...

                                                                                Energy-optimal software partitioning in heterogeneous multiprocessor embedded systems
                                                                                
            
                                                                                  
               
                                                                                • Michel Goraczko, 
                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                • Jie Liu, 
                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                • Dimitrios Lymberopoulos, 
                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                • Slobodan Matic, 
                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                • Bodhi Priyantha, 
                                                                                  • 
               
                                                                                • Feng Zhao
                                                                                  • 
            
                                                                                
            
                                                                                DAC '08: Proceedings of the 45th annual Design Automation ConferenceJune 2008, pp 191–196https://doi.org/10.1145/1391469.1391518
                                                                                
            
                                                                                
               		
               
                                                                                Embedded systems with heterogeneous processors extend the energy/timing trade-off
                  flexibility and provide the opportunity to fine tune resource utilization for particular
                  applications. In this paper, we present a resource model that considers the time ...

                                                                                  Towards an application-specific thermal energy model of current processors
                                                                                  
            
                                                                                    
               
                                                                                  • Vladimir Getov, 
                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                  • Darren J. Kerbyson, 
                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                  • Matt Macduff, 
                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                  • Adolfy Hoisie
                                                                                    • 
            
                                                                                  
            
                                                                                  E2SC '15: Proceedings of the 3rd International Workshop on Energy Efficient SupercomputingNovember 2015, Article No.: 5, pp 1–10https://doi.org/10.1145/2834800.2834805
                                                                                  
            
                                                                                  
               		
               
                                                                                  Recent developments of high-end processors recognize temperature monitoring and tuning
                  as one of the main challenges towards achieving higher performance given the growing
                  power and temperature constraints. To address this challenge, one needs both ...

                                                                                    A first step towards automatic application of power analysis countermeasures
                                                                                    
            
                                                                                      
               
                                                                                    • Ali Galip Bayrak, 
                                                                                      • 
               
                                                                                    • Francesco Regazzoni, 
                                                                                      •

                                                                                      •

                                                                                      • 
               
                                                                                    • Paolo Ienne
                                                                                      • 
            
                                                                                    
            
                                                                                    DAC '11: Proceedings of the 48th Design Automation ConferenceJune 2011, pp 230–235https://doi.org/10.1145/2024724.2024778

                  secret information from the physical implementation of cryptosystems rather than exploiting
                  weaknesses in the cryptographic algorithms themselves.                                                                                       How do code refactorings affect energy usage?
                                                                                      
            
                                                                                        
               
                                                                                      • Cagri Sahin, 
                                                                                        • 
               
                                                                                      • Lori Pollock, 
                                                                                        • 
               
                                                                                      • James Clause
                                                                                        • 
            
                                                                                      
            
                                                                                      ESEM '14: Proceedings of the 8th ACM/IEEE International Symposium on Empirical Software Engineering
                     and MeasurementSeptember 2014, Article No.: 36, pp 1–10https://doi.org/10.1145/2652524.2652538
                                                                                      
            
                                                                                      
               		
               
                                                                                      Context: Code refactoring's benefits to understandability, maintainability and extensibility
                  are well known enough that automated support for refactoring is now common in IDEs.
                  However, the decision to apply such transformations is currently performed ...

                                                                                        Energy-efficient power allocation in analogue network coding based multi-hop D2D communication
                                                                                        
            
                                                                                          
               
                                                                                        • Pengfei Wu, 
                                                                                          •

                                                                                          • 
               
                                                                                        • Longyan Xu
                                                                                          • 
            
                                                                                        
            
                                                                                        RACS '19: Proceedings of the Conference on Research in Adaptive and Convergent SystemsSeptember 2019, pp 200–205https://doi.org/10.1145/3338840.3355651

                  limited battery capacity. However, most of the studies on D2D communication based
                  on network coding focus on improving network throughput, and less on the coding and
                  ...

                                                                                          Dynamic Application-aware Power Capping
                                                                                          
            
                                                                                            
               
                                                                                          • Bo Wang, 
                                                                                            • 
               
                                                                                          • Dirk Schmidl, 
                                                                                            • 
               
                                                                                          • Christian Terboven, 
                                                                                            • 
               
                                                                                          • Matthias S. Müller
                                                                                            • 
            
                                                                                          
            
                                                                                          E2SC'17: Proceedings of the 5th International Workshop on Energy Efficient SupercomputingNovember 2017, Article No.: 1, pp 1–8https://doi.org/10.1145/3149412.3149413
                                                                                          
            
                                                                                          
               		
               
                                                                                          A future large-scale high-performance computing (HPC) cluster will likely be power
                  capped since the surrounding infrastructure like power supply and cooling is constrained.
                  For such a cluster, it may be impossible to supply thermal design power (TDP) to ...

                                                                                            Design Optimaztion of An Electromagnetic Gearing System for Wind Power Application
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                              
               
                                                                                            • Eljaroshi Diryak, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Otman Imrayed, 
                                                                                              • 
               
                                                                                            • Saad Zeid
                                                                                              • 
            
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                            ICEMIS'20: Proceedings of the 6th International Conference on Engineering & MIS 2020September 2020, Article No.: 60, pp 1–6https://doi.org/10.1145/3410352.3410796
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                            
               		
               
                                                                                            The conventional mechanical gearbox in the wind power application has been applied
                  in between the turbine and the generator. However, it has many drawbacks such as fixed
                  gear ratio which may restrict the output power. In order to improve the power ...
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                            
            
                                                                                            
               
                                                                                            
                  
                                                                                            
                     
                                                                                              
                        
                                                                                            • 
                           
                                                                                              
                              
                                                                                                
                                 
                                                                                              • 0
                                                                                                • 
                                 
                                 
                                                                                              • 12
                                                                                                •

                                                                                            • 
                           
                                                                                              /action/highlight?doi=10.1145%2F3410352.3410796&query=%28Title%3A%28code+OR+program+OR+software+OR+application%29+OR+Abstract%3A%28code+OR+program+OR+software+OR+application%29%29+AND+%28Title%3A%28optim*+OR+improv*+OR+automat*+OR+reduc*%29+OR+Abstract%3A%28optim*+OR+improv*+OR+automat*+OR+reduc*%29%29+AND+%28Title%3A%28energy+OR+power%29+OR+Abstract%3A%28energy+OR+power%29%29Highlights
                                                                                              
                        
                                                                                              •

                                                                                              Public Access
                                                                                              
         
         
                                                                                              Published By ACM
                                                                                              
         
                                                                                              
      
                                                                                              
      
                                                                                              
         
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                              Stochastic energy optimization for mobile GPS applications
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                                
               
                                                                                              • Anthony Canino, 
                                                                                                • 
               
                                                                                              • Yu David Liu, 
                                                                                                • 
               
                                                                                              • Hidehiko Masuhara
                                                                                                • 
            
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                              ESEC/FSE 2018: Proceedings of the 2018 26th ACM Joint Meeting on European Software Engineering Conference
                     and Symposium on the Foundations of Software EngineeringOctober 2018, pp 703–713https://doi.org/10.1145/3236024.3236076
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                              
               		
               
                                                                                              Mobile applications regularly interact with their noisy and ever-changing physical
                  environment. The fundamentally uncertain nature of such interactions leads to significant challenges in energy optimization, a crucial goal of software engineering on ...
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                              
            
                                                                                              
               
                                                                                              
                  
                                                                                              
                     
                                                                                                
                        
                                                                                              •

                                                                                                  •

                                                                                                Optimizing the energy consumption of large-scale applications
                                                                                                
            
                                                                                                  
               
                                                                                                • Moreno Marzolla
                                                                                                  • 
            
                                                                                                
            
                                                                                                QoSA '12: Proceedings of the 8th international ACM SIGSOFT conference on Quality of Software
                     ArchitecturesJune 2012, pp 123–132https://doi.org/10.1145/2304696.2304718
                                                                                                
            
                                                                                                
               		
               
                                                                                                The energy consumption of large IT infrastructures is becoming a major concern, since
                  it represents one of the principal operation costs. While modern devices (e.g., processors,
                  disks) have the capability of reducing their power consumption by running ...

                                                                                                  Automated checkpointing for enabling intensive applications on energy harvesting devices
                                                                                                  
            
                                                                                                    
               
                                                                                                  • Azalia Mirhoseini, 
                                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                                  • Ebrahim M. Songhori, 
                                                                                                    • 
               
                                                                                                  • Farinaz Koushanfar
                                                                                                    • 
            
                                                                                                  
            
                                                                                                  ISLPED '13: Proceedings of the 2013 International Symposium on Low Power Electronics and DesignSeptember 2013, pp 27–32
                                                                                                  
            
                                                                                                  
               		
               
                                                                                                  We propose a framework that enables intensive computation on ultra-low power devices
                  with discontinuous energy-harvesting supplies. We devise an optimization algorithm
                  that efficiently partitions the applications into smaller computational steps during
                  ...
